author: MARCO GIACOMELLI
title: Mesut Ozil reveals he didn't want to leave Real Madrid for Arsenal but Arsene Wenger's 'wise words' swayed him
text:
Friday 3 March 2017 12:30 GMT Click to followES Sport 'Most difficult decision': Mesut Ozil wanted to continue at Real Madrid AFP/Getty Images 
Mesut Ozil today revealed he had wanted to stay at Real Madrid prior to joining Arsenal but Arsene Wenger persuaded him to move. 
The German midfielder is in contract negotiations with the Gunners, with his current deal set to end at the end of next season. 
Ozil’s relationship with Wenger remains strong and his decision over whether to sign a new contract will depend in part on the manager’s next move. Wenger has yet to make a decision as to whether he will stay at the club. 
In the latest serialisation from Ozil’s autobiography published today in German newspaper Bild, the 28-year-old said joining Arsenal was the toughest decision of his life. He added: “I chose, although it was not easy for me at the beginning, a number which I had in my mobile phone since 2010.
